name: places/ChIJMzK4QlRYwokRkLID5IVMgTQ
formattedAddress: 242 W 45th St, New York, NY 10036, USA
adrFormatAddress: 242 W 45th St, New York, NY 10036-3901, USA

editorialSummary.text: Theater hosting plays & musicals in a 1,078-seat space built in 1927 in a modern Spanish style.

originalText.text: This is a beautiful theater that gives you the old-fashioned theater experience.  There are a lot of stairs but my seat was in the mezzanine.  I had second row mezzanine for PARADE and the seat was amazing.  I could see every movement as well as all the actors facial expressions.  The seats are very comfortable.  I am 6 feet with long legs and I was comfortable for the whole show.  At least in the mezzanine the rows had excellent rake so no people blocking your view.  PARADE is also a very intense show and it was good to see the audience respect that as well as the cast.  PARADE was superb and Ben Platt amazing as always.  This theater and show were the highlight of my recent NYC trip. Even the restrooms were spacious.

originalText.text: Such a nice theatre, quick process to get in the doors. Felt like all the seats were great too. Nice views on the floor all around and looked like the balcony could be the same. I saw Parade yesterday, all staff I talked to were very kind as well! I can’t recommend this show enough. Such a incredible storyline and cast

text.text: Such a nice theatre, quick process to get in the doors. Felt like all the seats were great too. Nice views on the floor all around and looked like the balcony could be the same. I saw Parade yesterday, all staff I talked to were very kind as well! I can’t recommend this show enough. Such a incredible storyline and cast

originalText.text:
This is a beautiful theatre. We went to see Almost Famous which is one of my favorite movies. It follows the movie and is a lot of fun. You'll recognize the music for sure.

One thing I would like to mention is how wonderful the House Manager (Judy) is. We had seats upstairs but I was feeling very sick to my stomach (dinner was not sitting well with me). Well Judy found us two seats near the restroom ...and I cannot thank her enough for helping us. She even came to check on me. She deserves a medal. I cant say enough about how accommodating she was.

The theatre is definitely beautiful and from what I can tell no bad seats. The seats upstairs do not give you much leg room though so if you are tall with long legs, buy tickets on the first level

I recommend this theater and the show 'Almost Famous'.

If you go, say hi to Judy and tell her thanks for me!

originalText.text: Went to see Parade. Great seats, show was a little flat (I know, probably on my own in this one). The theatre is easy to get around and comfortable seats so no complaints.

text.text: Went to see Parade. Great seats, show was a little flat (I know, probably on my own in this one). The theatre is easy to get around and comfortable seats so no complaints.

originalText.text: This theater is beautiful! Be forewarned, the seats are exceptionally small and there is little foot room, but the attention to detail in the paintings and restoration are beautiful.
